part.name: school_walk
part.narration: Down the street Jacques walks his children. As JJ and he stride ahead, Yuki trails behind. Yuki's picket-sign drags across the ground. Jacques' is slung over-shoulder. Jacques looks at his son. He halts.
part.line: A Japanese company bought our team.
part.narration: Yuki, mouth agape, halts. JJ stops walking. Jacques looks down. Jacques sighs. Jacques continues walking.
part.line: I suppose that's what happens when project planning gets costly.
Costly?
Yeah, it costs money to make video games.
I told Adeline to wait for the school year to end before the acquisition.
But, thanks to the the fools down at the Ministry, we had to agree to it yesterday.
Why?
The Software Identity Act?
Yuki, hush.
part.narration: Yuki slows to a stomp.No matter how the Player attempts to move her, Yuki will trail extremely far behind Jacques and JJ. The camera zooms out.Jacques looks at his son.
part.line: The Software Identity Act.
The Ministry of Culture wants all of the French software to stay French; especially video games.
They deemed games "artistically relevant," or something like that.
Whether or not this means that someone finally considers video games to be "Culture" is yet to be disclosed.
part.narration: The group of Jacques and children continue to walk. They pass a group of picket-sign holders three. Then, they pass a group of picket-sign holders nine. Then, 27. All yelling, all screaming. Jacques grins and turns to a picket-holder.
part.line: You protesting the SIA?
Sure am. Check the sign.
Our code is for the world
Right on, brother, right on.
We gotta convince these jokers to repeal the law. Check the sign.
Doom not the game industry
Word up! We gotta fight for our rights!
part.narration: 81. All yelling, all screaming. JJ stops there. He looks at Yuki's sign.
part.line: I never paid attention to what your sign said.
The youth code too — think of the future
part.narration: JJ watches Yuki continue walking.No scene progression until the Player leads Yuki through the crowd. Yuki treads, losing herself in a forest of pants.The Player, through Yuki, walks around.243. All yelling, all screaming. Mid-walk, a lone Policeman yanks from the outskirts of the crowd Yuki.
part.line: Little girl, what are you doing out here?
part.narration: The Policeman, tactical vest and club and helmet and — something shiny — a gun — looks down at Yuki. Yuki shivers.

choice.line: Great, parents use the children as launchpads to opine.
choice.narration: The Policeman grabs Yuki by the arm and drags her.

choice.line: And, I suppose, the three-hundred others too?
choice.narration: The Policeman grabs Yuki by the shoulders and shoves her.

part.line: Get your damn hands off Yuki!
part.narration: Jacques erupts from the crowd and punches the Policeman in the face. The Policeman collapses. The crowd stops. The crowd stares. Jacques gasps. Jacques rubs his chin, thinking of a plan. He snaps his fingers. Eureka! He pounds the ground.
part.line: Time to go!
part.narration: During most of this, the Player can move Yuki, but eventually,Jacques snatches Yuki from the crowd, carrying her under an arm. Jacques snatches his son from the crowd, carrying him under an arm. Jacques flees. Jacques runs and runs and runs. While in run, he looks at his son.
part.line: Son, make sure you look over for statements in the notes I printed for you.
I don't care if you have to do it during Art class, just do it.
Yuki, I hope you studied for the Biology test.
Test?
